colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to fill the menu's background with.

colour_id.name: headerTextColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for section header item text (see theaddSectionHeader() method).

colour_id.name: highlightColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to fill a highlighted row of the list.

colour_id.name: highlightedBackgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to fill the background of the currentlyhighlighted menu item.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the text.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for normal menu item text, (unless thecolour is specified when the item is added).

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour for the window.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the text.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to fill the background of the button area.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: A background colour to fill the bubble with.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: A colour to use to fill the editor's background.

colour_id.name: defaultTextColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for text when no syntax colouring is enabled.

colour_id.name: highlightColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the highlighted background under selected text.

colour_id.name: lineNumberBackgroundId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for filling the background of the line-number gutter.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: the colour used to fill the component's background.

colour_id.name: arrowColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the arrow shape that pops up the menu

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour to fill the box with.

colour_id.name: buttonColourId
colour_id.comment: The base colour for the button (a LookAndFeel class will probably use variations on this).

colour_id.name: outlineColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for an outline around the box.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the text in the box.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour used to fill the button's background (whenthe button is toggled 'off'). Note that if you use the

colour_id.name: backgroundOnColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour used to fill the button's background (whenthe button is toggled 'on'). Note that if you use the

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the button's text label.

colour_id.name: textColourOnId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the button's text when the button's toggle state is "on".

colour_id.name: currentPathBoxArrowColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to draw the arrow of the current path ComboBox.

colour_id.name: currentPathBoxBackgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to fill the background of the current path ComboBox.

colour_id.name: currentPathBoxTextColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the text of the current path ComboBox.

colour_id.name: filenameBoxBackgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to fill the background of the filename TextEditor.

colour_id.name: outlineColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for drawing the line around the edge.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour to fill the editor background.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour to fill the label with.

colour_id.name: backgroundWhenEditingColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour when the label is being edited.

colour_id.name: outlineColourId
colour_id.comment: An optional colour to use to draw a border around the label.Leave this transparent to not have an outline.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the text.

colour_id.name: textWhenEditingColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the text when the label is being edited.

colour_id.name: lassoFillColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to fill the lasso rectangle with.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour to fill the list with.Make this transparent if you don't want the background to be filled.

colour_id.name: outlineColourId
colour_id.comment: An optional colour to use to draw a border around the list.Make this transparent to not have an outline.

colour_id.name: keyDownOverlayColourId
colour_id.comment: This colour will be overlaid on the normal note colour.

colour_id.name: mouseOverKeyOverlayColourId
colour_id.comment: This colour will be overlaid on the normal note colour.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour, behind the bar.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour to fill the component with.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour of the scrollbar.

colour_id.name: thumbColourId
colour_id.comment: A base colour to use for the thumb. The look and feel will probably use variations on this colour.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: A colour to use to fill the slider's background.

colour_id.name: rotarySliderFillColourId
colour_id.comment: For rotary sliders, this colour fills the outer curve.

colour_id.name: rotarySliderOutlineColourId
colour_id.comment: For rotary sliders, this colour is used to draw the outer curve's outline.

colour_id.name: textBoxBackgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The background colour for the text-editor box.

colour_id.name: textBoxHighlightColourId
colour_id.comment: The text highlight colour for the text-editor box.

colour_id.name: textBoxTextColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the text in the text-editor box used for editing the value.

colour_id.name: thumbColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to draw the thumb with. It's up to the lookand feel class how this is used.

colour_id.name: trackColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to draw the groove that the thumb moves along.

colour_id.name: frontOutlineColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to draw an outline around the currently-selected tab.

colour_id.name: tabOutlineColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to draw an outline around the tabs.

colour_id.name: tabTextColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to draw the tab names. If this isn't specified,the look and feel will choose an appropriate colour.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to fill the background behind the tabs.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour of the table header background.It's up to the LookAndFeel how this is used.

colour_id.name: outlineColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour of the table header's outline.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour for the text in the header.

colour_id.name: buttonColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour used to fill the button shape (when the button is toggled'off'). The look-and-feel class might re-interpret this to addeffects, etc.

colour_id.name: buttonOnColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour used to fill the button shape (when the button is toggled'on'). The look-and-feel class might re-interpret this to addeffects, etc.

colour_id.name: textColourOffId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the button's text when the button's toggle state is "off".

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the text component's background - this can betransparent if necessary.

colour_id.name: focusedOutlineColourId
colour_id.comment: If this is non-transparent, it will be used to draw a box aroundthe edge of the component when it has focus.

colour_id.name: highlightColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour with which to fill the background of highlighted sections ofthe text - this can be transparent if you don't want to show anyhighlighting.

colour_id.name: highlightedTextColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour with which to draw the text in highlighted sections.

colour_id.name: outlineColourId
colour_id.comment: If this is non-transparent, it will be used to draw a box aroundthe edge of the component.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour that will be used when text is added to the editor. Notethat because the editor can contain multiple colours, calling thismethod won't change the colour of existing text - to do that, usethe applyColourToAllText() method

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to fill the background of the text area.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the editable text.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the button's text.

colour_id.name: tickColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the tick mark.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: A colour to use to fill the toolbar's background. Formore control over this, override LookAndFeel::paintToolbarBackground().

colour_id.name: buttonMouseDownBackgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: A colour used to paint the background of buttons when the mouse isheld down on them.

colour_id.name: buttonMouseOverBackgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: A colour used to paint the background of buttons when the mouse isover them.

colour_id.name: labelTextColourId
colour_id.comment: A colour to use for drawing the text under buttonswhen the style is set to iconsWithText or textOnly.

colour_id.name: separatorColourId
colour_id.comment: A colour to use to draw the separator lines.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to fill the background with.

colour_id.name: textColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the text.

colour_id.name: backgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: A background colour to fill the component with.

colour_id.name: dragAndDropIndicatorColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use for the drag-and-drop target position indicator.

colour_id.name: linesColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to draw the lines with.

colour_id.name: oddItemsColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to fill the backround of the odd numbered items.

colour_id.name: selectedItemBackgroundColourId
colour_id.comment: The colour to use to fill the background of any selected items.
